intro: Railliardia scabra var. leiophylla, commonly known as the smooth-leaved railliardia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
